skill.name: technical-research
skill.description: Technical spike and research investigation specialist. Use when exploring options for a technical decision, conducting timeboxed investigations, or evaluating technology choices.
skill.summary: Technical spike and research investigation specialist. Use when exploring options for a technical de...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based documentation skill containing only markdown templates. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or command execution capabilities. The skill provides structured guidance for conducting technical investigations.

content.user_title: Conduct Technical Spikes and Research Investigations
content.value_statement: Making technical decisions without proper investigation leads to costly refactoring and technical debt. This skill provides a structured framework for timeboxed technical spikes, proof of concept development, and objective technology evaluations with clear recommendations.
actual_capabilities: Conducts timeboxed technical investigations with clear objectives
Creates structured proof of concept implementations for each option
Compares technical options using weighted criteria matrices
Documents findings, risks, and dependencies comprehensively
Provides implementation roadmaps with phase breakdowns
Tracks unanswered questions and open decisions
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests automatically
Does not access external APIs or documentation directly
Does not perform performance benchmarking or load testing
Does not integrate with project management tools

use_cases.title: Evaluate Architecture Options
use_cases.description: Compare microservice patterns, event-driven designs, and modular monolith approaches with structured POC code and criteria matrices.

use_cases.title: Assess Technology Feasibility
use_cases.description: Determine if new frameworks, libraries, or tools are viable for your stack within defined time and resource constraints.

use_cases.title: Investigate Technical Solutions
use_cases.description: Explore implementation approaches for complex features with documented trade-offs, risks, and clear recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: New Technology Evaluation
prompt_templates.scenario: Evaluating a new framework for adoption
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Technical Research skill to evaluate [FRAMEWORK_NAME] for [USE_CASE]. Set a timebox of [HOURS] hours. Our constraints are [CONSTRAINTS]. We need to answer: 1) How easy is the learning curve? 2) What is the performance impact? 3) What are the long-term maintenance implications?

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a technical spike on [DECISION_TOPIC]. Explore at least 3 options. Create POC code for each. Use criteria including [CRITERIA]. Provide a recommendation with clear rationale and implementation path.

prompt_templates.title: Performance Investigation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Technical Research skill to investigate [PERFORMANCE_ISSUE]. Timebox: [HOURS] hours. Document the root cause analysis, potential solutions with benchmarks, and recommended fix with effort estimates.

prompt_templates.title: Library Comparison
prompt_templates.scenario: Selecting the best tool for the job
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare [LIBRARY_A] vs [LIBRARY_B] for [USE_CASE]. Create a comparison matrix with criteria: community support, documentation quality, bundle size, performance, and maintenance burden. Include POC code snippets demonstrating key differences.

output_examples.input: Evaluate Next.js vs Remix for our e-commerce platform. Timebox: 4 hours. Constraints: Must support SSR, needs good SEO, team is familiar with React.

best_practices: Define success criteria and specific questions to answer before starting the spike
Stay within the timebox and document what was not investigated
Create runnable POC code rather than theoretical analysis
anti_patterns: Spiking without clear objectives or success criteria
Exploring only one option instead of comparing alternatives
Skipping the implementation path and risk assessment sections
Exceeding the timebox without clear justification

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides structured templates that any LLM can follow for technical investigations.

faq.question: How long should a technical spike take?
faq.answer: Most spikes should be timeboxed to 2-8 hours depending on complexity. Longer investigations should be broken into multiple focused spikes.

faq.question: Can I use this for non-technical research?
faq.answer: The framework can be adapted for any structured investigation. The template focuses on technical options with code samples and comparisons.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-only skill with no code execution or network access. Your data remains in your conversation and is never transmitted externally.

faq.question: How do I handle spikes that exceed their timebox?
faq.answer: Document what was accomplished, what remains unanswered, and recommend a follow-up spike. Partial findings are still valuable when properly documented.

faq.question: How is this different from just asking an AI directly?
faq.answer: The skill provides a rigorous framework ensuring consistent, comprehensive investigations with documentation, trade-off analysis, and actionable recommendations.
